Mexican Street Corn Tacos

Jump to Recipe

Get ready to tantalize your taste buds with our delicious Mexican Street Corn Tacos! This vibrant recipe combines the bold flavors of fresh corn, creamy mayonnaise, and zesty lime juice, perfectly encapsulating the essence of authentic Mexican street food. Whether you're planning a casual family dinner or a lively taco night with friends, these tacos are sure to impress. With just a few simple ingredients like Cotija cheese and chili powder, you can create a mouthwatering dish that’s both satisfying and easy to make. Plus, they’re perfect for customization—add your favorite toppings and enjoy a burst of flavor in every bite! Dive into this article to discover how to prepare these delectable tacos that will transport you straight to the streets of Mexico!

Ingredients

corn (fresh or canned)

If using fresh corn, choose ears that are plump and milky when you pierce the kernels. For canned corn, drain and rinse to reduce sodium. You can also substitute with frozen corn; just thaw and drain before using. To enhance flavor, try roasting the corn in the oven or on the grill for a smoky taste.

taco shells

For a healthier option, consider using lettuce leaves as a low-carb alternative. If you prefer homemade, you can make them from corn tortillas by lightly frying them in oil until crispy. Warm the shells before filling to make them more pliable and enhance their flavor.

mayonnaise

For a lighter option, substitute Greek yogurt or sour cream. To add more flavor, mix in some garlic powder or chipotle in adobo sauce. If you want a vegan option, use vegan mayonnaise or avocado as a creamy base.

cotija cheese (crumbled)

If you can't find Cotija cheese, Feta or Queso Fresco can be good substitutes. To enhance its flavor, try toasting it lightly in a dry pan before crumbling. For a dairy-free option, consider using a nut-based cheese.

lime juice

Freshly squeezed lime juice is always best for flavor. If you don't have lime, lemon juice can be used as a substitute. To enhance the lime flavor, consider adding lime zest to the dish.

chili powder

You can substitute chili powder with a combination of paprika and cayenne pepper for heat. For a smoky flavor, try using smoked paprika. Adjust the amount based on your heat preference.

cilantro (chopped)

If you dislike cilantro, you can replace it with parsley for a milder flavor or use green onions for a different herbaceous note. For the best flavor, chop cilantro just before adding it to the dish.

salt

Always taste as you go when adding salt. You can use sea salt, kosher salt, or even flavored salts like garlic salt for added depth. If you want to reduce sodium, consider using lemon zest or a salt substitute.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Corn

    Start by grilling or sautéing the corn until it's slightly charred, about 5-7 minutes. If using fresh corn, you can cut the kernels off the cob after grilling. For canned corn, just sauté it to warm through.

  • Step 2: Make the Creamy Sauce

    In a mixing bowl, combine the mayonnaise, lime juice, chili powder, and a pinch of salt. Stir until well-blended. This creamy sauce will add flavor and richness to your tacos.

  • Step 3: Combine Ingredients

    In a large bowl, mix the charred corn with the crumbled Cotija cheese and chopped cilantro. Pour the creamy sauce over the mixture and gently fold everything together until the corn is evenly coated.

  • Step 4: Assemble the Tacos

    Take your taco shells and fill them generously with the corn mixture. If you like, sprinkle some extra Cotija cheese and chopped cilantro on top for added flavor and presentation.

  • Step 5: Serve and Enjoy

    Serve the tacos immediately with lime wedges on the side for an extra zesty kick. Enjoy your delicious Mexican Street Corn Tacos!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare fresh corn for cooking?

To prepare fresh corn, start by removing the husks and silk. Hold the ear of corn upright and use a sharp knife to cut down the sides to remove the kernels. You'll need about 2 cups of kernels for this recipe.

How do I know when the corn is cooked properly?

Whether grilling or sautéing, cook the corn for about 5-7 minutes until it's slightly charred. You'll know it's done when the kernels are tender and have some nice golden color.

What is Cotija cheese and where can I find it?

Cotija cheese is a crumbly Mexican cheese with a salty flavor. You can find it in the cheese section of most grocery stores, especially those with a good selection of international products. If you can't find it, feta cheese can be a good substitute.

Do I have to use mayonnaise in this recipe?

Mayonnaise is used to create a creamy sauce, but you can substitute it with Greek yogurt or sour cream for a lighter option. Just keep the flavor profile in mind!

Can I prepare the corn mixture ahead of time?

Yes, you can prepare the corn mixture in advance! Just store it in the refrigerator, but it's best to fill the taco shells just before serving to keep them crispy.

What's the best way to store leftover tacos?

If you have leftovers, store the corn mixture and taco shells separately in airtight containers in the refrigerator. This will help keep the shells from getting soggy.

What can I serve with Mexican Street Corn Tacos?

These tacos pair well with lime wedges, a fresh salad, or refried beans. You can also serve them with a side of salsa for extra flavor.

How do I chop cilantro without making a mess?

To chop cilantro, rinse it thoroughly and pat it dry. Gather the leaves together, hold them firmly, and use a sharp knife to slice through them in a rocking motion. Keep your fingers tucked in to avoid cuts.

What if I don't have chili powder?

If you don't have chili powder, you can use a mix of paprika and a pinch of cayenne pepper for some heat, or even taco seasoning if you have it on hand.

How do I know when my taco shells are ready to use?

If you're using pre-packaged taco shells, they are usually ready to eat as is. If you choose to warm them, you can do so in the oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 5-7 minutes to make them crispier.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a vegetarian option, ensure the mayonnaise is egg-free or substitute it with a vegan mayonnaise. If gluten-free tacos are needed, use corn tortillas instead of traditional taco shells. To reduce calories, consider using Greek yogurt in place of mayonnaise. For a dairy-free version, omit the Cotija cheese or replace it with a plant-based cheese alternative.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing, serve the Mexican Street Corn Tacos with grilled chicken or shrimp for added protein. A refreshing beverage such as a classic Mexican Horchata or a light lager beer like Corona or Pacifico complements the flavors beautifully. For a non-alcoholic option, a limeade or sparkling water with a splash of lime juice enhances the taco's vibrant taste.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the tacos on a colorful platter with lime wedges and extra cilantro for garnish. Consider providing a variety of hot sauces on the side for guests to customize their heat level. For added texture and flavor, top the tacos with pickled red onions or avocado slices. Serve with a side of tortilla chips and guacamole for a complete fiesta experience.

#

Mexican Street Corn Tacos

25 min
$10
320 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyEgg

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Mexican

Course:

MainSnack

Tags:

EasyQuickTacosMexican

Description

Delicious tacos filled with grilled corn, creamy sauce, and zesty lime for a refreshing bite.

Ingredients

  • corn (fresh or canned): 2 cups
  • taco shells: 8 pieces
  • mayonnaise: 1/4 cup
  • cotija cheese (crumbled): 1/2 cup
  • lime juice: 2 tablespoons
  • chili powder: 1 teaspoon
  • cilantro (chopped): 1/4 cup
  • salt: to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
